Challenge 3: data wrangling

Author

Mohamed, Islam

1 Challenge:

1.1 Patent Dominance

What US company / corporation has the most patents? List the 10 US companies with the most assigned/granted patents.List the 10 US companies with the most assigned/granted patents.

library(vroom)
#> Warning: package 'vroom' was built under R version 4.2.3
library(tictoc)
#> Warning: package 'tictoc' was built under R version 4.2.3
library(tidyverse)
#> Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'tibble' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'tidyr' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'readr' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'purrr' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.2.3

#> Warning: package 'forcats' was built under R version 4.2.3
#> Warning: package 'lubridate' was built under R version 4.2.3

library(data.table)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'data.table'
#> 
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:lubridate':
#> 
#>     hour, isoweek, mday, minute, month, quarter, second, wday, week,
#>     yday, year
#> 
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr':
#> 
#>     between, first, last
#> 
#> The following object is masked from 'package:purrr':
#> 
#>     transpose
#> 
#> The following object is masked from 'package:tictoc':
#> 
#>     shift
col_types <- list(
  id = col_character(),
  type = col_character(),
  number = col_character(),
  country = col_character(),
  date = col_date("%Y-%m-%d"),
  abstract = col_character(),
  title = col_character(),
  kind = col_character(),
  num_claims = col_double(),
  filename = col_character(),
  withdrawn = col_double()
)
patent_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "03_data_wrangling_files/Patent_data/patent.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: type, number,
#> country, abstract, title, kind, filename, withdrawn
uspc_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "03_data_wrangling_files/Patent_data/uspc.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
#> number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
patent_assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "03_data_wrangling_files/Patent_data/patent_assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
#> number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "03_data_wrangling_files/Patent_data/assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: number,
#> country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
#---------------------Question 1------------------------
class(assignee_tbl)
#> [1] "spec_tbl_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"
setDT(assignee_tbl)
class(patent_assignee_tbl)
#> [1] "spec_tbl_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"
setDT(patent_assignee_tbl)
class(patent_tbl)
#> [1] "spec_tbl_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"
setDT(patent_tbl)
tic()
Q1_patent_data <- merge(x = patent_assignee_tbl, y = assignee_tbl, 
                       by.x="assignee_id", by.y ="id",
                       all.x = TRUE, 
                       all.y = FALSE)
toc()
#> 0.1 sec elapsed
setkey(Q1_patent_data, "assignee_id")
key(Q1_patent_data)
#> [1] "assignee_id"
Q1_patent_data %>% dim()
#> [1] 315910      4
keep_cols <- c("assignee_id","patent_id","organization")
Q1_patent_data <- Q1_patent_data[, ..keep_cols]
Q1_patent_data %>% dim()
#> [1] 315910      3
Q1_patent_data %>% glimpse()
#> Rows: 315,910
#> Columns: 3
#> $ assignee_id  <chr> "org_004j997jM9yEdS7z4ReD", "org_004j997jM9yEdS7z4ReD", "…
#> $ patent_id    <chr> "8728438", "8921361", "8857791", "8845559", "8815936", "8…
#> $ organization <chr> "University of Basel", "University of Basel", "Zetkama Sp…
#Count_Q1 contains the data of the companies/organisations and the number of patents they hold in descending order
tic()
Count_Q1<- Q1_patent_data %>%
  filter(!is.na(organization)) %>%
  count(organization)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.44 sec elapsed
#Print the top 10 companies in a descending order
head(Count_Q1,10)

IBMC holds 7547 patents. This is the highest number of patents in this year.

2 Challenge:

2.1 Recent patent activity

What US company had the most patents granted in August 2014? List the top 10 companies with the most new granted patents for August 2014.

class(patent_tbl)
#> [1] "data.table" "data.frame"
setDT(patent_tbl)
#Q2_patent_all has patent,patent data,assigned data merged
tic()
Q2_patent_all <- merge(x = patent_tbl, y = Q1_patent_data, 
                        by.x="id", by.y ="patent_id",
                        all.x = TRUE, 
                        all.y = FALSE)
toc()
#> 0.38 sec elapsed
#Selecting a timeframe (Aug 1 2014 to Aug 31 2014) and building a new data frame Q2_Aug_patents
Q2_Aug_patents<- with(Q2_patent_all, Q2_patent_all[(date >= "2014-08-01" & date <= "2014-08-31") ])
#Count_Aug has the data of all the organisations that got a patent in Aug 2014 in desc order 
#with number of patents
tic()
Count_Aug<- Q2_Aug_patents %>%
  filter(!is.na(organization)) %>%
  count(organization)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.05 sec elapsed
#Company with most patents, Aug 2014
head(Count_Aug,1)
#Top 10 companies with new patents, Aug 2014
head(Count_Aug,10)

The above list shows the top 10 companies with the most new granted patents for August 2014.

3 Challenge:

3.1 Innovation in Tech

What is the most innovative tech sector? For the top 10 companies (worldwide) with the most patents, what are the top 5 USPTO tech main classes?

tic()
Q3_patent_all <- merge(x = uspc_tbl, y = Q1_patent_data, 
                       by.x="patent_id", by.y ="patent_id",
                       all.x = TRUE, 
                       all.y = FALSE)
toc()
#> 3.9 sec elapsed
#Most innovative class can be calculated by summing the total number of patents for each class
tic()
mostinnovative_class_Q3<- Q3_patent_all %>%
  filter(!is.na(mainclass_id)) %>%
  count(mainclass_id)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.3 sec elapsed
#creating a dataframe of top10 companies only to investigate the top 5 USPTO
Q3_top10 <- Q3_patent_all[Q3_patent_all$organization %in% c('International Business Machines Corporation','Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.','Canon Kabushiki Kaisha','Sony Corporation','Microsoft Corporation','Google Inc.','Kabushiki Kaisha Toshiba','QUALCOMM Incorporated','LG Electronics Inc.','Panasonic Corporation'),]
#adding a new column with has Company name & Class together titled "Company_Class"
Q3_top10$Company_Class <- paste(Q3_top10$organization, Q3_top10$mainclass_id)
#Counting the Company_class and arranging in desc order
tic()
Q3_top10_CC<- Q3_top10 %>%
  count(Company_Class)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.01 sec elapsed
#displaying the most innovative class and its corresponding number of patents of that class
head(mostinnovative_class_Q3,1)
#Shows the top 5 USPTO Classes from the top 10 companies granted patents
head(Q3_top10_CC,5)

The above table shows the top 5 USPTO tech main classes, from the top 10 companies in a descending order
